meanings.definition: A cap or cover at the end of something, such as a shelf or aisle.
meanings.sent1: The endcaps of the shelf keep the items from falling off.
meanings.sent2: The store manager placed colorful endcaps on the shelves to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked off the endcaps and played with them like toys.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, bouncing off the endcaps of the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The shiny endcaps gleamed under the bright store lights.

meanings.definition: The final section of a retail display.
meanings.sent1: Customers often notice the endcaps first when browsing in a store.
meanings.sent2: The endcaps are strategically designed to promote new products.
meanings.sent3: The endcaps stood proudly at the corners of the store, showcasing the best deals.
meanings.sent4: The endcaps marked the beginning and end of the shopping experience.
meanings.sent5: The endcaps displayed the latest trends in fashion and technology.

meanings.definition: To place endcaps on a shelf to finish the display.
meanings.sent1: She carefully endcaps the shelves to create an appealing layout.
meanings.sent2: The team will endcaps the aisles before the grand opening.
meanings.sent3: He endcaps the shelves with precision and attention to detail.
meanings.sent4: Endcaps the display with creativity to catch the customers' eyes.
